com.esri.mo2.map.prt
Interface TocPrinter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseTocPrinter
public interface TocPrinter

A TocPrinter captures the current state of the Toc, such as which Layers are shown.

To print a Toc, you need to first obtain a TocPrinter object, using a Toc's createTocPrinter method. In your application code, call the TocPrinter's print(graphics) method to perform the actual printing.

When creating a TocPrinter, you need to specify the Toc's "Imageable Area" in printer pixel units. This is a Rectangle that describes the size and location of the printed Toc on paper. When your code calls the TocPrinter's print(Graphics) method, the units of the specified Graphics object will be assumed to be printer pixels (defined to be 1/72 inches).

See Also:
Toc.createTocPrinter(java.awt.Rectangle)

Method Summary
 void print(Graphics g)
          Prints the given Graphics object.
